If a rich, captivating story is your cup of tea, then pick up this jewel of a game. Bioshock Infinite takes place in the steampunk, floating City of Columbia. All of the wonderful elements that makes Bioshock so much fun are back along with a few new, invigorating features. You'll laugh, you'll scratch your head in mystery, and you'll rage after encountering the Handyman. All in all, Bioshock Infinite is one of the most well rounded FPS out there. You'll be left wanting more.

Buy the game... do it.
Vale o preço.

This game plays like a great, compelling interactive movie.  Really elevates gaming to a new level, in my opinion.  Shame Irrational did continue after this, but it is a hard act to follow.  Amazing story, acting, and graphics.

Yes.

I just finished the game and I've never been so mind blown in my life. I feel as though inception was trumped in the aspect of crazy ass endings. Not to mention the gameplay is very fun and very action packed. I recommend that even if you hate first person shooters or Bioshock you buy this game strictly for the story. By far my all time favorite campaign. If this was a movie i would buy it and watch it everyday. Damn this is a great game. Buy it now.

Luego de culminar el último dlc de este juego me cabe decir lo siguiente: realmente esto no es un juego, es una pieza maestra y no por sus gráficos o estilo de shooter, sino más bien, por su historia.
Para aquellos que curtimos Bioschock desde sus inicios, Infinite pone en marcha un desenlace perfecto que cierra magistralmente con Panteón Marino Episodio 2.

Me vale decir que recuerda mucho a la quinta temporada de Breaking Bad en el sentido que los guionistas logran darle un cierre definitivo a cada personaje de la historia, algo bastante complicado de hacer cuando tenes un producto bien contado y con el que te ha ido muy bien. Y cuando digo cierre no me refiero a que cada personaje cierra su ciclo luego de jugar Panteón Marino sino, más bien, te ayuda a comprender porque pasa lo que pasa. Entonces, atando cabos... podés comprender completamente la historia y trazar una línea en los hechos.

El punto fuerte y por el cual recomiendo con propiedad esta obra de arte devenida en videojuego, es la historia y sus "constantes y variables" que giran en torno a ella. Es un mandato obligado jugar los anteriores 2 y si continuas con Infinite, es imperativo adquirir los DLC para ponerle la frutilla de la torta a esta fantástica historia.
Realmente fue un placer jugarlo y entenderlo. Obviamente aún no alcancé todos los logros pero, ahora que ya fue finalizado, puedo alcanzarlos jugando de una manera mas relajada.

Le otorgo un puntaje 11/10!!!

This game is literally driving me crazy! I can't stop thinking about it. Somebody might say that an average man thinks about sex every 7 second. Well I think about this game every damn seven seconds! It's just that GOOD! Only if I could remove my memory to experience it all over again... I've been seriously depressed lately because of this.
I think I made it very clear that this game is worth playing. I loved every second of it and it did make me very confused sometimes, but I did figure it all out eventually. This game has the best story in a videogame I have ever seen, and the athmosphere of Columbia is just perfect. Characters are near perfection, especially Elizabeth. The gameplay is... good. It's not bad, not at all, but usually I just want to quickly shoot my way trough enemies just to start scavenging around and progressing into the story. Just as I said, the story is somewhat confusing to wrap around your head, but you'll figure it out. The dlc:s are also worth playing. I could almost say that I enjoyed burial at sea even more than the main game. I won't spoil anything, but the ending made me cry like a little bitch. OVERALL THIS GAME IS WORTH EVERY CENT AND IF YOU ARE GOING TO BUY THIS DO GET THE SEASON PASS AND PLAY TROUGH BIOSHOCK 1 BEFORE BURIAL AT SEA JUST TO GET THE FULL EXPERIENCE!

Jogo fantastico, com uma jogabilidade exelente, e com uma história de tirar o folego, com viagens no tempo, miniboses incriveis, e uma coisa que irá te supreender no final, sem duvidas meu game favorito, gostei demais, quem estiver em duvida se deve comprar ou não, saiba que vale muito a pena e te garanto que você ira gostar muito do game, os vigores do game são muito bons e não muito op´s, adorei essa implantação dos SkyLines e também gostei muito da Elizabeth te ajudando em meio a suas batalhas, dando munição e dinheiro!(Um spoilerzim, em uma parte do game você passa por Rapture).É so isso que tenho a dizer, que o game é incrível e que eu recomendo a todos que curtem FPS ou que curtem um jogo com uma história fantastica!!
Flw,fiquem com deus!

Bienvenidos a Columbia, una ciudad construida sobre las nubes con esperanzas y sueños de gente que buscaba algo mas de la vida, pero que al igual que Rapture esconde una oscura historia bajo sus cimientos de dolor y sufrimiento de algunas personas. Una ciudad donde la discriminación al obrero y las clases mas bajas pasará factura a los ignorantes pobladores de esta bellisima, enorme y curiosa ciudad. Sé el amo de la revolucion y rescata a la chica.

Totalmente recomendable! poderes ,armas de fuego y una gran movilidad por el mapa. A mi me ha ganado <3

About the game, yes it's a masterpice. Unlike the first two games, now you're not a survivor or a Monstrous-like creature who roam an underwater city, now you're Booker DeWitt, a war veteran with unknown debts and now tasked to rescue a girl in a flying city, Columbia.
Columbia, unlike rapture, is a beatiful city. Everyone's happy until you showed up and accused for being a false sheperd. Now the whole city is your enemy, and you must fight your way to save Elizabeth, a Mysterious girl guarded by a giant steam-powered beast known as The Songbird and of course the ruler of the city, Comstock.

The game now is not about survival, it's about a fight. So, you're not spending time collecting medkits and eve or planning an attack on splicers like the first two games, It's a whole different genre. In Bioshock: infinite, the combat is fast, more weapons and ammunitions so you don't need to save ammunitions like in the first two games. Also there are Vigors, pretty much like Plasmids, but with the fast combat system, using these superpowers is much more fun as you can combine one vigor with others. and you don't have to worry about the Salts (Eve version of Bioshock Infinite) or ammunitions and medkits, because Elizabeth is one of the best NPC Companion ever (She'll find those things in a fight) 
And for the world and the story, it's pretty good. The vibe and the music of the game is awesome. I like the bond between the two main characters and i think many people would agree with me that this game has the most Mind-Fu** ending ever. 
Overall this is a very good game, you don't have to play the first two games to understand the story, Recommended!

Игра нравится! Прохождение по аналогии с предыдущими биошоками, но с доработками конечно же. К примеру, в предыдущих биошоках персонаж таскал с собой тучу оружия и в бою игрок превращался в пианиста, потому как приходилось постоянно переключаться между разным оружием и разными видами патронов(кто играл, тот знает). Здесь же проще: что под ногами валялось, то схватил и пошел стрелять, с собой носишь только два оружия, пистолет (постянно) и что-либо посерьезнее (из того что находишь у убитых противников или в процессе исследования местности). Тоников, как в прошлых частях игры, нет, их роль заменила одежда, которая обладает определенными свойствами. Плазмиды схожи по свойствам с предыдущими играми (пока не все собрал). Элизабет это конечно большой + в игре! Поиграв немного я понял почему по ней все так тащатся :D Красавица и ваш союзник по игре. Вскрывает замки, во время боя находит вам то аптечку, то патроны, то соли (энергия в игре благодаря которой можно использовать сверх способности) ато и целую турель, как зайца из шляпы, достанет. В мирное время подогревает деньгами ну и своим присутствием, конечно ;) В общем игра- супер! Красиво и интересно. Рекомендую!)
This is an amazing game! you shoud get it!

海底都市が二人の変態親父に壊滅させられたため空に理想郷を求めたもう一つのBioshockです
(1と2をやっていなくても楽しめますが個人的には先にやっておいたほうがより世界観を掴みやすかったかなと思います)

今作はsteam版でも日本語吹替がありヒロシとぷちこの漫才を楽しむことが出来ます
また精度は高くありませんが設定画面からセンシ・FOVの調整が可能になり本シリーズ特有の厄介なcfg弄りから開放されました

内容としては1や2と異なり明るい空の下でヒロインを連れて暴れまわるという内容になっており大分方向性が変わりました
序盤に広がる空中都市の美しい青空は鬱屈とした深海で息を潜めていた前作までの暗さと大きく対比している部分であり象徴的なシーンとなっています

システムで面白かった点としてはパートナーを守る系のゲームとしては珍しく相手を気にかける必要がない上戦場でアイテムを掻き集めてくれるためその姿が非常に斬新で美しくドラマティックな演出に昇華しているところ
これはシナリオにおける互いの絆においても強い影響を与える事に成功しており本作品最大のセールスポイントです

また前作までの欠点として8スロットを越える銃の所持数で操作が若干煩雑な部分がありましたが今回これを2つに制限したことで地形やプラスミドを活かした戦闘が良く演出されています
特に空中にレールで浮かぶ船を飛び渡りながらフックで襲撃していくデザインは刺激的なものでスナイパーライフルでの狙撃等FPS定番の要素も熱い演出が多くBioshockらしい完成度を高めた極めて優秀な作品といえるでしょう

ただシナリオ全体としては最後の最後まで話が全く見えてこないタイプで中盤から少しついていけなくなる上ゲームの難易度としても平行線なので終盤少しダレてしまったのが残念でした
シナリオ・グラフィックの美しさその他諸々"印象的"という意味でいえばこのゲームは間違いなくシングルFPS作品の中ではトップクラスの作品だと思いますので感動をお約束するとまではいきませんが是非多くの方にプレイして頂きたいと思います

Bioshock Infinite has always been an interesting series in the history of video games. The developers of the game wen't all out with this one and it turned out just fine. The game visually looks like a painting and it's a beautiful site to behold. Often I stop and take in all that I am looking at. The people in the background doing their own thing, Barbershop quartet. But I feel that all of this really overshadows the rest of the game. Is Bioshock Infinite overrated? Yes, but I still think it's worthy of a playthrough. I feel that too many people praized this game eventhough it's not that amazing as people say it is. If you like a story with a FPS Style themed game, than you would enjoy this for sure.

So, here's the story. The story is about the protagonist of the game, Booker dewitt who has find a girl named Elizabeth and bring to her back to a certain person in New York. Once he finds Elizabeth, you'll be surprised at how good and realistic they made her. Almost all the time through the game, her character was very spontanious. The voice acting in the game is very satisfying. The combat in the game is also pretty satisfying as well. I played with the sniper rifle pretty much the whole time in my playthrough because I found it awesome to see the enemies head blow off when shoot. I found this game also to be a handy tool to improve your aim in games. And with the new addition of vigors, you'll have more variation in your kills. Something that was a little disappointing in the game was the half non and half linear level design and I love games where you can explore everything in the level but this game sort of lacks that. I also don't like that you walk in an empty room, go into the next door, all enemies and you kill them, walk into another empty area and walk upstairs and more enemies and kill them all and then another empty area. If you know what I am talking about, you'll understand what I mean. 

But this is the thing that I truly dislike the most about the game. It's too damn easy! Yes, when you are in combat, Elizabeth often throws you ammo, salts, and health whenever something is low and I actually don't like the idea of that. I also don't like when you press a key on the keyboard and there's an arrow that points you in the right direction. I'd rather ignore all of these things and enjoy the game without it being this easy. I'd like a challenge with these types of games. There are different types of big daddy's in this game now and they are like elderly people put into this body to prolong their life. Without spoilers I would like to say my opinions of the ending. Let me just say, ending are not always that easy when people make a game and this ending is a little illogical at first, but on further notice you begin to think more about it and you kind of reflect about everything that happened in the game. Apart from that I would give it a 7/10. You should better play the original Bioshock because that is a true classic. This game got too much praize for what it was actually not, but I'd still reccommend it.

I just finished the last DLC of this game (Burial at Sea Episode 2), and I'm just blown away by this amazing work of art.

This game is simply amazing. 

There will be [b]spoilers[/b] ahead for anyone who hasn't played this yet.

[b] Story [/b]
----------------------------------

Bioshock Infinite's story is possibly one of the most complex stories that I've ever encountered in a game. The whole concept of infinite universes and 'constants and variables' is an ever present theme throughout the series. 

After completing the base game, I was left with a few questions, but the two follow-up DLCs: Burial at Sea 1 & 2, gave me such an emotional and satisfying ending that I was left with no ill-feelings. I'll just say straight up that if you love a good story, which is so massive and complex, yet understandable, this game is perfect for you.


[b] Gameplay [/b]
----------------------------------
Bioshock Infinite has some very enjoyable gameplay. Combining FPS, with rapid skylines, and vigors (special abilities), makes this game mind blowingly awesome. Every shot, every power, feels impactful. The visual detail is stunning for a game which has an almost 'cartoony' feel to it. Riding skylines, and hopping from location to location feels amazing and action-filled as you quickly hop off to take down an enemy, only to run back and swing along looking for your next target. 

For the more tactical players, setting off vigor traps, or possessing enemy structures can turn the tide of battle in an instant. 

The weapons....oh man the weapons. The time period of this game brings back all the 'old-school' weapons which have a certain kind of feel to them which can't be explained. The detail of the gun models, the sounds, the firing rate, and the damage it inflicts just gives a satisfying feeling at the end of a battle. There are all kinds of weapons for any kind of player. Snipers, pistols, shotguns, grenade launchers, and a ton more. 

Gameplay wise, this game deserves a playthrough at the very least...but no, there's more...

[b]Characters[/b]
----------------------------------
Oh my god, where do I begin?? First off, Elizabeth is possibly the most lovable, attractive, helpful character I've ever seen in a game, period.

The voice actors for both Booker, and Elizabeth are simply amazing. They made the characters feel so real, so personal, and the story could not have gone anywhere without top quality voice actors.



There's literally paragraphs upon paragraphs I could write about this masterpiece of a game, but no, buy this game and it's DLCs. Play it. Enjoy it. 

9.9/10 [spoiler] I wanted Elizabeth to live :'( [/spoiler]

As usual, Bioshock delivers. I love the art direction they took in this game, and I like during the "populated" areas that almost every NPC has their own dialogue. Really breathes some life into the game, only wish there were more areas like it. The story gets a little "out there" near the end, but its not hard to follow even if you're just slightly versed in the multi-verse theory. The game is definitely more cerebal than the other games and really had me thinking about the ending for hours after beating the game. I recommend whole heartedly!

One of the best games you shall ever play the gameplay is outstanding to modern shooters and very refreshing though sometimes it may feel slow with the mouse and I but hand hurting but overall great. The story will toy with and minipulate your emotions with such a great force it may trigger you to cry or feel empty simply just wanting more you might cry or drop a tear like i did. Honestly this is game is completly worth the price along with the hole Bioshock series it makes you think morally and actually is a piece of art that should be preserved. The city is amazing. It can be a fast paced shooter. But if you give the game lets say a 4month break the story will be so great that you wont forget a single event. The charectors are perfect and feel like real people in every way and no other game will make me feel the same way Infinite did. In my personal opinion its a very sad and happy story that honestly prooves games are much more than just a form of entertainment and shooting, so no this game deserves to be credited and that everyone who thinks games are just stupid and useless they should play this and then think of how games can be art just as much as movies and books are. The DLC burial at sea seams to lack in PC mouse/ keyboard control and is way easier on a controller but the story is solid and is a mandatory get to understand the story even greater. I do advise that you play the DLC after you finish the main game though. 
Also the OST and played music within the game just makes you feel content and meaningful to this world that is corrupt.
My review I give it a 10/10 it is a must to anygamer who cares about story and not just a 12 year old who loves COD. this game is truly worth your time and more.

Booker DeWitt un detective privado de la Nueva York de 1912 es encargado de rescatar a Elizabeth que vive en una ciudad llamada Columbia, una utopía sobre las nubes... Ken Levine vuelve a traernos una historia subversiva usando como esqueleto la estructura del primer Bioshock. Haciendo una brillante crítica social al excepcionalismo y los dogmas de fe. Columbia consigue tener una estética única pero es difícil lograr que algo sea tan atmosférico como lo que consiguió Levine con Rapture en el Bioshock original.

En cuanto a lo que más me ha disgutado del título ha sido su jugabilidad, ya que como la mayoría de juegos de la séptima generación vende su sustancia a favor de copiar el estilo jugable de títulos como Call of Duty con el objetivo de atraer al público adolescente y sumar ventas, evitando así una inmersión total ya que al menos en mi caso mientras estaba disfrutando de la ambientación, de repente me tenía que poner a pegar tiros...

En retrospectiva es una gran historia con un final al que no dejarás de darle vueltas y desde luego es el juego más valiente que he visto de la industria AAA desde Dark Souls y Spec Ops: The Line.

Por cierto, es imprescindible jugar los DLCs del Panteón Marino, ya que es ahí donde se cierra la historia al completo de la saga.

Si te gustan los videojuegos y crees en ellos como más que un mero entretenimiento debes comprar este juego.

A very interesting game, the graphics are phenomanal, the gameplay is really fun especially with the skyhook and vigor abilities, the world and story are fascinating, and Elizabeth be my baby yo... back the fuck up nigga

Vyborna hra. Uzasny pribeh. Skvela hratelnost. Co dodat. Kupte to. Prekonava to podle me i prechozi hry v Rapture.

10/10

Когда я впервые услышал об игре с летаюшим городом мне показалось, что эта игра не заслуживает внимания. Ведь я небыл знаком с играми Кена Левина, а со студией Irrational Games не был знаком вообще и поэтому в серьёз её не воспринял. Как сильно я ошибался! 
    Утопия в летающем городе и Колумбия заставили меня передумать. Ещё надо отдать должное Анне Молевой, которая "подарила" внешность Элизабет. Её история по свойму грусна и драмматична. 20 лет в огромной башне, из друзей только огромная птица и гора книг. По сути ребёнок во взрослом теле, который может открывать разрывы ( дырки в другое, паралельное измерение). Почти всё время игры проведённое с ней, мы наблюдаем как она превращается из маленького ребёнка в душе во что-то по своему пугающее, а в конце игры у неё варабатывается пофигизм ко всему живому кроме Комстока. К стати пара слов о нём. Он вместе с Лютэс поднял колумбию в воздух, и населил её идиотами которые свято верят что Комсток пророк и несёт слово Бога. К моему удивлению Лютэсы не конченые психи, как кажется на первый взгляд. Ведь это именно они начали эту историю с возвращением Анны ДеВитт обратно Букеру, однако в реальности где она Элизабет ДеВитт этого не помнит.
    Так вот эта игра мне нравится за то, как игроков втягивают в происходящие события, как игрока привязывают к персонажам. Ведь большую часть игры Элизабет является аппаратом поддержания жизнедеятельности, оборонным комплексом и соледобывающем заводом. И когда нас с ней разлучают то испытываешь потребность в её помощи, или просто становится скучно и всё превращается в тупой экшн без смысла. 
     И в заключении хочется сказать что в игре: хорошо мотивированные и продуманные персонажи, отличный сюжет, хорошая картинка, приятный саундтрек "Will the Circle be Unbroken" (который слышится почти во всех ключевых сценах игры)  ну и в триллере Nico-Vega постарались. В игре почти нет недочётов (сам говорить не рискну ведь для каждого они свои). Ну а если вы не уснули и дочитали это до конца, то меня игра ОЧЕНЬ ОЧЕНЬ ОЧЕНЬ сильно потрясла и удивила (даже стыдно что купил со скидкой), всем советую, 11 баллов из 10.
good game, but its a complete rip-off of home alone 2
Игра просто великолепная

Bioshock Infinite is the third Bioshock title and takes place in 1912 where you play as Booker DeWitt an investigator that is sent to find a girl named Elizabeth in a floating city called Columbia to erase his debt.

The atmosphere in Bioshock Infinite is very different than the first two games as it takes place in a city in the sky. The graphics are amazing. I really like the characters and voice acting in Bioshock Infinite. Bioshock Infinite's story is very great. The story is quite confusing and the ending is truly mind-blowing. You don't have to play the first two games to understand Bioshock Infinite.

However, the gameplay is a little weaker than the first two games as you can only use two weapons at a time. The weapons in Bioshock Infinite are a little bit boring. The missions get boring as you progress. You can't save the game at any time unlike its predecessors. You can only rely on autosave which is annoying sometimes.

Nevertheless, Bioshock Infinite is still an outstanding game. If you like the game, I suggest getting the Burial at Sea DLC. I really recommend this game
Best. Game. Ever.

Never really been a fan of the Bioshock Franchise. Barely played the first, beat the second, but after beating the campagin of Infinite my mind was blown, without a doubt the biggest twist in a game for me. Not only did the story impress me it also made me very interested in playing the previous installments  over again. One thing I witnessed across the board was the stunning enviroment throughout the games, whether it be a city underwater or lifted beyond the clouds the Bioshock franchise simply was quite a site. The weaponry and set of powers are also a fun mechanic and offer various ways to take out your foes.  I highly recommend the Bioshock trilogy to those who have not enjoyed its beauty and great storytelling.

Despite my lack of time in this game on steam, I have played and beaten it on my XBOX360. I only bought it again so it would be in my library (it was on sale). As a result, I can't give to much detail on PC graphics other than they are nice.

PROS:
[list]
[*]Fun gameplay
[*]Really interesting world
[*]Cool and intense plot
[/list]
CONS:
[list]
[*]Gameplay gets repetitve towards the end (you have to beat a boss 3 times in a row)
[*]Plot falls apart if you think to much about it
[*]Controller not required, but much better than keyboard/mouse controls
[/list]

Overall, a fun experience, and a good sendoff to Irrational's Bioshock series. I have the DLC on XBOX360, and it is actually quite fun.

7.5/10

Hm. Strange game. Not sure if it was a mistake to play without even looking at the first two parts... It was very hard to "get into" the game. I was like ??? - I couldn't get a grasp at the story for a good few hours. It is quite hard, the keyboard controls needed redefining for my liking (eg. Z and Y are swapped on my keyboard). So all in all a strage, good looking, hard and ~long game. With a lot of shooting.

Verry good game, if you follow the storyline it can truly toy with your emotions.

Que jogo fantástico! Fazia um tempo que eu tinha ele na biblioteca e só agora que me dediquei a entender e fechar. As possibilidades são enormes em questão de estratégia de combate. Os gráficos impressionantes, a narrativa da história, a coerência, jogabilidade. Não tem um ponto sequer que eu considere negativo. Vale a pena cada centavo. Dá pra jogar várias e várias vezes.
Sobre o jogo é um FPS. Vc começa o jogo sozinho, mas grande parte dele é com a Elizabeth. Vc possui variedade de armas e poderes pra se adequar a sua estratégia. Nos cenários vc tem o seu destino, mas pra encontrar moedas, energia, etc vc tem a possibilidade (quase uma obrigação) de vasculhar cada espaço. Diferente de outros games, não é necessário proteger sua parceira, ela se vira sozinha e ainda por cima te ajuda, dando mais espaço ainda pra estratégias diferentes. Conta com uma boa variedade de armas, upgrade das mesmas e de poderes.
Mais uma vez eu digo: vale cada centavo.
Just finished the ending. Not a fucking clue. Nope. Not a chance. See you later. Bye.

當時是大特價把Bioshock 1, Bioshock 2和Bioshock Infinite一次過帶回家, 玩完Bioshock 1和2後覺得的確是好遊戲, 可是用8個小時破了這Bioshock Infinite....這是它喵的神作阿!!!!
在這我不作任何劇透, 只能說劇情非常出色, OST更是將幾首經典歌曲重新演繹, 特別是由Elizabeth(Courtnee Draper)翻唱的Will The Circle Be Unbroken. 一百多年前的老歌, 可是把Infinite全破後再聽, 竟然另有意思!!
除了Will The Circle Be Unbroken外, 豪邁的Beast of America和幽婉的Elizabeth也非常動聽, 大家不妨聽聽~
